meanings.definition: The quality or state of being honorable.
meanings.sent1: Her honorability shone through when she returned the lost wallet.
meanings.sent2: His honorability was evident in the way he always kept his promises.
meanings.sent3: The honorability of the knight was so strong that even dragons respected him.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of deceit, her honorability was a beacon of light.
meanings.sent5: The honorability of the firefighter risking his life for others was truly admirable.

meanings.sent1: With his honorability, he always chose to do what was right.
meanings.sent2: Teaching children about honorability is important for building character.
meanings.sent3: The honorability of the superhero allowed him to resist the villain's temptations.
meanings.sent4: Her honorability was like a shield, protecting her from dishonesty.
meanings.sent5: The honorability of the leader inspired trust and loyalty among the team.

meanings.sent1: The honorability of the king was known throughout the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Integrity and honorability are valued traits in a person.
meanings.sent3: The honorability of the cat who returned the stolen fish was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: His honorability was like a bright aura that surrounded him.
meanings.sent5: The honorability of the judge in delivering fair verdicts was unquestionable.
